<h1><a id="user-content-crsp-to-compustat-link-table" class="anchor" href="#crsp-to-compustat-link-table" aria-hidden="true"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="octicon octicon-link" height="16" version="1.1" viewBox="0 0 16 16" width="16"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M4 9h1v1H4c-1.5 0-3-1.69-3-3.5S2.55 3 4 3h4c1.45 0 3 1.69 3 3.5 0 1.41-.91 2.72-2 3.25V8.59c.58-.45 1-1.27 1-2.09C10 5.22 8.98 4 8 4H4c-.98 0-2 1.22-2 2.5S3 9 4 9zm9-3h-1v1h1c1 0 2 1.22 2 2.5S13.98 12 13 12H9c-.98 0-2-1.22-2-2.5 0-.83.42-1.64 1-2.09V6.25c-1.09.53-2 1.84-2 3.25C6 11.31 7.55 13 9 13h4c1.45 0 3-1.69 3-3.5S14.5 6 13 6z"></path></svg></a>CRSP to COMPUSTAT Link Table</h1>
<p>CRSP.CCMXPF_LINKTABLE provides linking information between gvkey and permco</p>
<p>Link types are restricted to primary link types and USEDFLAG is restricted to be 1.</p>
<blockquote>
<p>Primary Link Types<br><b>LC:</b> Link research complete (after extensive research by CRSP). Standard connection between databases.<br><b>LU:</b> Link is unresearched by CRSP. It is established by comparing the Compustat and historical CRSP CUSIPs. LU represents the most popular link type.<br><b>LS:</b> Link valid for this security only. Other CRSP PERMNOs with the same PERMCO will link to other GVKEYs. LS links mainly relate to ETFs where a single CRSP PERMCO links to multiple Compustat GVKEYs. In Compustat, even though they may belong to the same investment company (e.g. ISHARES), ETFs are presented with different GVKEYs and CRSP flags this situation.<br><b>USEDFLAG</b> item notes if a link was used to to build a composite GVKEY record corresponding to the PERMNO. It originates from the CCMXPFLNKUSED table and is therefore CRSP-centric. It may be helpful in cases of multiple securities to establish a connection between all securities involved, even those not directly linked<br><br> More info <a href="https://wrds-web.wharton.upenn.edu/wrds/support/Data/_001Manuals%20and%20Overviews/_002CRSP/ccm-overview.cfm#section09">https://wrds-web.wharton.upenn.edu/wrds/support/Data/_001Manuals%20and%20Overviews/_002CRSP/ccm-overview.cfm#section09</a></p>
</blockquote>

<h1><a id="user-content-optionm-standardized-options" class="anchor" href="#optionm-standardized-options" aria-hidden="true"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="octicon octicon-link" height="16" version="1.1" viewBox="0 0 16 16" width="16"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M4 9h1v1H4c-1.5 0-3-1.69-3-3.5S2.55 3 4 3h4c1.45 0 3 1.69 3 3.5 0 1.41-.91 2.72-2 3.25V8.59c.58-.45 1-1.27 1-2.09C10 5.22 8.98 4 8 4H4c-.98 0-2 1.22-2 2.5S3 9 4 9zm9-3h-1v1h1c1 0 2 1.22 2 2.5S13.98 12 13 12H9c-.98 0-2-1.22-2-2.5 0-.83.42-1.64 1-2.09V6.25c-1.09.53-2 1.84-2 3.25C6 11.31 7.55 13 9 13h4c1.45 0 3-1.69 3-3.5S14.5 6 13 6z"></path></svg></a>OPTIONM Standardized Options</h1>
<pre lang="{r"><code>secids &lt;- paste("",as.character(unique(SECNMD_MONTHLY$SECID)),"",collapse=", ",sep="")

# testing secid = 207283


# run_query(paste("select * from optionm.",database[14]," where secid in (",207283,") &amp; year(date)&gt;=2002  ",sep=""))
# fetch_last_query(name="OPTION_DAYS",rows = -1)


OPTION_DAYS &lt;- NULL
years &lt;- c(2002:2016)
for(yr in years) {
  run_query(paste("select min(secid) as secid,min(year(date)) as year, min(month(date)) as month,max(days) as max_days_opt_exp from optionm.stdopd",yr,"  where secid in (",secids,") group by secid,year(date),month(date)",sep=""))
  fetch_last_query(name=paste("OPTION_DAYS",yr,sep=""),rows = -1)
  eval(parse(text=paste("OPTION_DAYS &lt;- rbind(OPTION_DAYS,OPTION_DAYS",yr,")",sep="")))
  eval(parse(text=paste("rm(OPTION_DAYS",yr,")",sep="")))
}

OPTION_DAYS['data_month'] &lt;- as.yearmon(as.Date(paste(OPTION_DAYS$year,OPTION_DAYS$month,"01",sep="-")))
OPTION_DAYS &lt;- OPTION_DAYS[!(is.na(OPTION_DAYS$max_days_opt_exp)),]
OPTION_DAYS &lt;- OPTION_DAYS[!duplicated(OPTION_DAYS[,c("secid","data_month")]),]
OPTION_DAYS['SECID'] &lt;- OPTION_DAYS$secid
OPTION_DAYS &lt;- OPTION_DAYS[,names(OPTION_DAYS)[!names(OPTION_DAYS) %in% c("year","month","secid")]]

OPTION_DAYS &lt;- data.table(OPTION_DAYS)
setkeyv(OPTION_DAYS,c('SECID','data_month'))

stargazer(head(OPTION_DAYS,10),summary = FALSE,type="text")
</code></pre>
